column1: Sinnar is a city and a municipal council in Sinnar taluka of Nashik district in the Indian state of Maharashtra.

column2: the Seuna or Yadava dynasty (850 - 1334) ruled a kingdom stretching from the Tungabhadra to the Narmada Rivers
column4: north Karnataka and parts of Madhya Pradesh. The capital was at Devagiri
column5: now known as Daulatabad in Maharashtra. The reign of the Yadava dynasty declined after the conquest of the Daulatabad Fort by Alauddin Khalji in 1294. Further conquest by Malik Kafur
column7: in 1312 resulted in the killing of the members of the Yadava clan ending this illustrious dynasty. It is also the birthplace of Baji Rao I
column8: the mighty general of Maratha Empire.

column1: Sinnar is located at 19.85°N 74.0°E﻿ / 19.85; 74.0. It has an average elevation of 651.4 metres (2135 feet). Sinnar is one of the major industrial zones of Malegaon (MIDC) built around the city of Nashik which have multiple international production companies. It lies 30 km southeast of Nashik city on the Pune - Nashik Highway.
